thread.title: LeBron, Michelle Obama join forces in Akron
thread.title_full: LeBron, Michelle Obama join forces in Akron

author: Meg Shaw
title: LeBron, Michelle Obama join forces in Akron
text:
LeBron James, Michelle Obama team up in Akron to encourage higher education WEWS Previous Next 
AKRON, Ohio - LeBron James and Michelle Obama are teaming up in Akron Wednesday to encourage students to pursue higher education. 
This is part of the first lady's Reach Higher initiative, which aims to inspire kids to complete education past high school, whether it's a professional training program, a community college or a four-year university. 
As part of that initiative Michelle Obama will join LeBron for a special event in Akron with thousands of parents and students involved in the LeBron James Family Foundation's Wheels for Education and Akron I PROMISE Network programs. 
The event will kick off at the University of Akron campus at 2:30 p.m. 
Earlier this year, the LeBron James Family Foundation announced a partnership with University of Akron that will provide full-tuition scholarships to qualified Akron public school students in the I PROMISE program.
